intro: Meibomia dasyloba, commonly known as the rough-leaved meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. Its leaves are typically rough to the touch, giving it its common name. Meibomia dasyloba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
